content: Just completed this! Really enjoyed it, controls were a bit fiddly to get used to at first but soon got them sussed. A perfect game, especially in lockdown! 10/10
Not the best port of final fantasy 6 but decent for the phone
Controls are something to get used to but the game is still amazing. Can't wait to finish it.
Ps4 controller connected to Android but not working in game? Is there no controllsr support for this game???
Didn't even want to start. Twice I've tried already. I need my full refund that's just wrong

I was enjoying FF6 when it just stopped working. It loaded in stay on few seconds then crash out. I would have to restart tablet to exit out of the game. Tried reinstalling it to no avail . Did not try resetting tablet though I did before installing ff6 the first time,as I currently need other apps on it.
Poor. Controls are useless.
Lock the screen on android 9 each time a battle start or the menu is open or there is a map transit

basically im an old school SNES fan of this game. They have changed alot of dialogue making it not as good story wise. changed alot of esper and equipment names making it confusing. And have super dumb downed the difficulty.
Some improvements made. Thank God for cloud saves.
Dang decent port of an all time classic.
Best!
So good!!
An Awsome Remake of Very Old Final Fantasy Game Recommend It For Anyone
It was a pretty great port and update, but the recent addition of these awful looking tan borders is puzzling. Why not just use black borders that aren't so visible/jarring? Any way to restore that?

The control are awful, the d-pad doesn't want to work properly half the time. The gameplay isn't that bad. The story is lovely just like in the original port. This sadly will be the closest thing to a remake as Square Enix really love the sweet money from 7.
Good port, but should have kept the original graphics.

I got this refunded due to the border on the screen. I'm not talking a black border on either side of the screen - because that would've been fine. It was this horrible gold border with diamond shapes on on either side of the screen. I'm gutted to be honest because the game is great, and I don't mind the updated sprites. But jesus christ, atleast give people to change or remove the border. It would've been fine with just a plain black border.
Not worth it. Controls are wonky, the art has been bastardized, menus are sluggish, combat is nothing like the original. Don't buy this version.

First. I paid for the game why can't I put it on my other devices and have to pay for it again? Two what's up with the border that you cannot get rid of. Been playing this franchise ever since it came out years ago. But go figure Google gets a hold of something and now destroys it. I want to answer on that or you'll never get a dollar for me again

Alright, so what's with the screen? You guys charge about as much for the mobile versions of your games as we paid for the physical copy upon release, and you give us a tiny little screen in the middle of our device with a funky border on the sides..? Get real... There should be an option to remove that... I'm not tryin to pay $16 for a tiny little screen to play on. There should also be something in the option menu to switch between the remodeled graphics and the classic. I'm not impressed...
This is one of the best story of final fantasy but please fix the direction button. FFIV direction button is better than this game.
Text unreadable outside of battle and in game menus.
Pretty badass! Just as I remember from 30yrs ago
Enjoyed it immensely.
One of the greatest JRPG's of all time, great port.
A modern new final fantasy where you have a team and turns in battle with new graphics.
Great port and great game.
Great
They should have it on ps store also just like 7,8 and 9.. OR just remake it like 7 story line in this game is one of the best..

Just finished FF9 and it was an amazing port!!! This one however leaves a bit to be desired. Joystick movement is very clunky and there is a bit of lag. It was perfectly playable however and It is still the game we all know and love. I switched from the atb gauge system and played in classic mode because it was hard to get used to how they set it up.
Loves me some fantasy of the final variety especially #6
I'm a Big fan. Love it.
One of if not the best FF of them all. Worth every penny!
Cant even order a refund
Final Fantasy VI closes out on my tablet and goes to my 4 digit pass code. Happens all the time with fights and going in a room.
where's my purchase on this bought this game
Chanced my thought, this game is awsame, the kefka worship tower boss is hacked but thats all ff6 games but whenyou find a way round that, the game is awsame

It's still final fantasy 6, which is a great game. But I don't know why they felt the need to redo the sprites they're all butt ugly which confuses me since they could've just reused the sprites from the original and it would've looked way better The controls are bad too and I've had problems with this app crashing. If it's the ONLY way you can play FF6 than alright, it's still a good game but this is probably the worst possible way to play it. Purchase or emulate the original
I love my old favourite game remake 😁
the overworld wont load in certian areas making the game unplayable, please fix this.
After my full play through, I will give my full review. So far one star up for cloud save feature
Solid gold

Love this game growing up and with it being accessible through mobile is amazing no complaints everything is pretty much straight forward. The only significant change is the bottles and the movement but that's it.

Classic final fantasy. Excellent game, story and battle mechanics. Different from other titles pre 7, combines first person, side scrolling as well as normal above camera movement. Different battle abilities such as blitz with tekken-like input , different stances for your samurai and cool tool abilities from machinist!
Marvellous version of my faviroute game of all time. Couldn't recommend enough
Classic
The dynamic D pad is frustrating especially trying to talk to someone moving
Awesome game.
Plz fix game for everytime I play it it goes to my screen lock and I have to unlock it every time plzzzzz
Great to play this again. By far my favorite Final Fantasy.
Love this
Old school FF, what's not to like
The controls make it unplayable and the original SNES graphics were better.

One of the best Final Fantasy games! Although I prefer the old graphics, these new ones didn't bother me too much once I got immersed in the story and gameplay. The latter can sometimes be too easy (if you know what you're doing), and there isn't a lot of challenge in general, but it is still a really enjoyable game that I would recommend to all fans of JRPGs.

I would love to give this port a 5 star rating but it keeps crashing at the same spot. It crashes when Shadow and Sabin enter the tent in the camp every single time. SE needs to fix this because it makes it unplayable. Edit: It seems like the bug got fixed! I was able to progress without having the game crash on me.

I love this game, and would love to play it again, but it is ridiculous that Square requires internet connection for all of its games. For those of us that primarily have idle time in subways or other areas with poor connections it is worthless.

Update: Tried playing this again on a new phone. No crashes at the places I said I was crashing at. Currently in the WoR with no problems. Im not sure if square patched it, or if its the new phone's hardware. Either way its working for me. Only real complaint now is the touch direction controls...but I dont think that can be helped.
Top 10 alltime game

I've gotten through this game twice and I have little problems with it. The controls on it can certainly use a bit of work but for a game made in the 90s it's definitely manageable. Still one of my top favorite Final Fantasy games ever made.
Always loved this game and still do. Quick save is great for game and go play.

Biggest complaint is controls. Please know you can change the battle button layout in CONFIG which makes it more comfortable. Unfortunately walking controls kinda suck but you manage. Other than it's a great port.
An all time classic!
My fav game of all time!, But please make customizeable layouts like the older versions, that would put another Star
Damn game is hard...
Nes.. controls please 15 dollars to ruin it wth. Side pick control not even sure about the characters lot ppl sure won't like that have played as kids 😜 kinda want a refund ugh was so exited..
Love this classic rpg

The graphics are fine, you definitely get used to them, the main issue lies in the controls. The problem is that the movement is based on tiles, so you can't move incrementally. This creates a very jarring overall experience, and it's a shame because I was hoping for the same smooth experience I had with the mobile remaster of 5. This can be remedied through the use of a controller (which is thankfully supported) but this shouldn't have to be an issue.
The snes version is better.
Great game, horrific controls
Controls made my hands fall off. But the gameplay is holy.

The game itself is as good as ever but sometimes the game will slow down during some cutscenes and, to me at least, the art style looks bad, some might like it so if you like it the lag might be the only problem. (This is just my experience with it, also the price is a little much.)
Great port. I dunno why it has such a low rating. You can get around the "offline loading" problem by loading the game once with an internet connection. After that I have no issues playing offline.

I hate the sprites. I love this game, absolute adore the music and story but HATE the way this port looks. Surely square can make the game look more like it's PC counterpart. It's 2020 and I'm playing 3DS games on my phone these days. They can afford to update this game to a modern standard. It's a classic that isn't being done justice.

This is what those RPG Maker games are trying to be! The story is classic, and has been spoken of greatly for decades now. As for this port: the controls are quirky but you could get used to them in a couple hours. I dislike how the app handles longer screens, by adding a yellow frame at the edges; if only the colors were configurable, or at least I wish it were darker so I could ignore it.

The nostalgia is big with this game, back in the early 2000s I brought an OG PS1 with a copy of FF6, I never liked FF during those days but getting FF6 brought me to the FF world and I've never looked back with bad memories, now having FF6 on phone I love it and enjoy playing as often as i can. But the only major draw back is the game "requiring" an internet connection to even load up, PLEASE take that feature out as it's hindering the offline play capability of the game
Great classic JRPG. The story and atmosphere is amazing.

Great port of a classic game, IF you connect a game controller. The updated character sprites can be jarring at first, but I think the high resolution enemy sprites and backgrounds balance that. Soundtrack is still amazing, uses the original SNES midi music instead of the lower quality GBA midi. Touch screen interface is decent but I prefer a controller, the classic controls elevate the port to another level. Rivalling the original US SNES release for my favourite version of my favourite games.
The BEST RPG game ever created, better than FF7 in my opinion. Please release FF6 REMAKE on PS5 console soon..
What experience? The game downloads to 100% then will not install, and I can't even get a refund because your system won't let me request one!
Hate it. It looks terrible.
It's hard to port to mobile, but the devs have managed admirably.

I think the best way of describing this game is "charming." This is definitely the pinnacle of the 2D FF games, it takes all the best aspects of the early games while adding in the mechanics that took the series where it is today. I can never decide which FF game is my favorite, but this one is always in the conversation. Highly recommended, and well worth the price

Some of these ports are okay but don't be surprised if they stop working. Don't think u will get adequate help from square. With this large if a company these ports really aren't that good. On top of that square does not seem to support their products.
The best game ever.. Best story, best characters, best music, best gameplay Best of the best
I at this he while eating pancakes and doing nothing with my life. I highly recommend.

This was a favorite from my youth. Controls for moving Character sprite is bad. Certain quests are timed and because it's hard to maneuver the character sprite to interact with moving npcs you end up overshooting the npc or targets location, wasting time. This is critical in a certain quest speaking to npcs that is timed. Not speaking to enough npcs means you cant get the full reward. Missing out on rare items. The people who made this port need to improve that.
Eh, I really hate the redesigns. They really take me out of it. Honestly, all you need is the option to switch to the original designs.

Multiplayer via internet capability insufficient, multiplayer connectivity to multiversital world generation is insufficient. Multiplayer capacity exceeds maximum threashold of meltdown due to insufficient multiplayer formulation based modulations allowing multipliers full spectrum access to free-flow creation.

I got bit by the nostalgia bug this weekend and I decided to buy this game, for the 3rd time in my life. Once you get used to the controls of moving around, everything else is like riding a bike again. My only slight complaints are these. This game makes my new One Plus 7 Pro run quite warm and battery life is kinda poor. Other than that, I look forward to finishing this game again over time and reliving the Final Fantasy VI experience again!
Fun childhood Game
The best FF out there. FF7 is mediocre when compared to FF6. Im happy to be able to play this again.
Never had the chance to play FF6 back when it was released in PS1. Bought and beat the game, have to say it has one of the best stories in FF history, beating FF7 and FF9 by a margin imo
Bug fixed. My favorite game. Only issue is it's hard to control your character on maps sometimes.
It's a great game but the controls are terrible not even half good I literally stopped playing this game to write this review because landing the ship is a frustrating.

Though Final Fantasy VI (initially called Final Fantasy III in North America) is an important part of gaming history, its venerable age means that some of today’s gamers haven’t played it for themselves. However, you don’t necessarily need to play it to appreciate its impact. All you need to understand is how unique Final Fantasy VI is among its peers; it features a huge ensemble cast, complex themes, and a story that subverts the “plucky heroes save the world” structure.
I still cant get in to the game Always forced stop Please help I already contact your official web, still no solution

graphics were better the oldschool way. runs and plays fine though, except the UI is VERY ugly. Then again, as are the new unpixilated graphics. The gameplay and story is still here, which is what's most important.

This is my all time favorite video game, and I was overjoyed when I discovered it on Google play. The story is amazing and they have done a wonderful job adapting it for mobile. Now I can share this game with my children for them to enjoy.

I saw some bad reviews on this... Honestly not sure what they expected. The story characters and pacing are off the charts. Music sets the mood well, and the graphics are acceptable. There are some wonky control issues but cell phones aren't exactly designed for good controls. Honestly the blitz commands are a little easier to use than the original. There are some design choices I would have done differently (the exit to title screen button appears immediately under your finger after you save)

SE literally took the GBA port, including the cropped aspect ratio, and dumped some new assets on top of it. This means you're getting less screen space than SNES, plus the amateurish sprites. 8-way directional input is nice, as is the translation and new enemy sprites, but just look at the character models. For some reason they've been drawn in the wrong angle, so the characters look like thin and stretched out. The menus are outright terrible, too. As a positive...it's FF6 on your phone?
Best FF, great version, but the controls need improvement, and the art style could be improved.

EDIT: since my review, the listed problems have been solved. Great job! I just rated this the other day highlighting how Kefka's tower crashes on a Pixel XL running Android 8.0.0, while it works on a Nexus 6P running 7.1.2. Add Hidon's cave to that list. Square's help link only sends an automated email telling you to scour a generic FAQ page for all their products without regard to platform.
awesome
Good game
Good,but control for moving is frustrating
Amazing game with only minor annoyances among the controls and small glitches
The trick to this mobile ports of console game is to get a wireless/Bluetooth controller, and game play becomes a breeze!
Awesome simply awesome
Port works perfectly. One of the best games of all time.

FFVI is one of my favourite games ever; it would take a lot for me to not give this rave reviews. But I don't think there's a reason for the game to be as big as it is, and I know most people would have preferred the older graphics.

I've really enjoyed replaying this game in this format. This is a solid port with a good UI and the updated GBA script. The combat programming is unique and adds a new element of challenge in a good way. And the music is a remaster of the original. My only real gripe is the character movement feeling unnecessarily clunky.

An amazing port of one of my favourite Final Fantasy games. The level of detail in the spritework and art is amazing, and the music and story are still fantastic. I find the controls well optimized for touchscreen devices as well. I can't recommend it enough. :)
I love this game!! Great job
Awesome and fun game
Quick save locks you forward with no escape if your not carful. Dont feel like starting the game over so im done. Too bad i really was looking forward to playing this.

I love FFVI. It's my favorite game of all time. That being said while I appreciate the attempt at updating the graphics I think it was a miss, personally. Feels too much like someone got their hands on RPG Maker and remade FFVI.
Great game, good port, d-pad sucks though
I finally managed to beat it! I've had ff6 since anthologies. Enjoyed the experience, my only grumble is movement with the weird dpad thing being frustrating
This game is unplayable. The controls are the worst controls I've ever come across. How the he did you mess it up this bad.
Its a freaking game from super nintendo era. Quit being elitist douchebags and enjoy one of the greatest games from the Final Fantasy genre.
Wont even install note 9
One of my all time favorites.been playing this one since i was a kid... Wish it had an easier contrler insread of the joystick
Great to have this on Android. Seems to be a battery hog, could use some optimization.
This game was awful but they fixed and now it's awesome again
Great game

Complaints about this implementation are valid, but it remains a great game! I originally played it on SNES as Final Fantasy 3, and it was my first experience with the series. This port leaves a lot to be desired, but nevertheless I've enjoyed it. I'm at the end of the game and about to fight Kefka, but I want to finished leveling everyone's magic from Espers first. I just wish they'd give this a proper remake.

I bought the game and I have "an error occured" error message and I cant have a refund. This is bull .. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling as well as powercycle and it is still not working with the same error message
Clunky D-pad mars an otherwise excellent mobile port of one of the best FF titles.
IMMENSE FUN !
Magitek facility crashing bug fixed. Game awesome again.
REMOVE THE BODERS OR GIVE ME A REFUND!!
Best RPG EVER! works fantastic on my android s9. Great additions from the snes port.

I can only describe it for my phone. The text is so saturated and pixelated, I can't read the words. I know it says "new game", but only because I know. I can't read anything. I could give two stars and power through this (the music is still great), but once you start taking damage and trying to pick abilities, I can't read a thing.
I wish the game would not return me back to the title after I quick save. I wish the controls were better.
Doesn't even work. It can't sign in to Google Play. I want a refund. EDIT: I uninstalled it and reinstalled, and it finally works! I couldn't be happier!

Edit: The crash that happened after the magitek facility is fixed, but I haven't checked the other one I mentioned (I would need to play new game to figure it). ORIGINAL: I would rate 5 stars. But the game keeps crashing on my Google pixel. It would crash when Kefka tries to stop you and Setzer. It would also crash whenever you try to enter a tent when Domma was being attacked.
Issue with crashing fixed over a year and a half later. Great game restored to its majesty. 5/5
The controls feel slippery. I had just played ff5 on mobile and it felt perfect. Wth? In all honesty it's a great game. Also, not enough nudity.
After over a year and a half, the unavoidable crash seems to have been fixed. Hopefully no other issues will pop up.
They fixed where the game breaks. All time fave.
It's fixed 😁
I hated the controls. Items kept disappearing from my menu, and when I'd save the game, it put me back 5 save spots and I'd have to do it all over again. I'm done .
Doesn't launch on Android 10? Or at least the note 10 Stalls connecting to Google play account can't access cloud save

Waste of $15! The onscreen joypad is NEVER a good idea on a tablet. Its literally in the way! The RPG itself seems pretty good but the controller just destroys the WHOLE game! I know some users prefer this format so I'll avoid the giving advice. Personally, I prefer "touch the screen- move to the spot" format.
Wont play in my note 10+. So disappointment
The app works boys as of 1-26-20 no longer crashes at factory or the camp thanks for the fix guys!!!

Game does not load. Same with FF5. Used to load no problem, but tried using it this morning and both games are in constant loading, even after uninstalling and reinstalling. Extremely disappointing that a company I used to love so much is a shell of what it used to be

I've already played this on PS1 but having it on my phone seemed like a good idea, unfortunately there are some issues, firstly the game needs an auto-run option in the menu because walking speed is too slow to play this game, secondly it needs a stretch to screen option as the borders are quite annoying or at the very least the option to change the border color to black as this would look better and save battery on OLED screens, I will change my review to 5 stars if these changes are made.

Le jeu fonctionne parfaitement bien, je n'ai aucuns soucis de mon côté. Et pourtant je suis sur un vieux Huawei P8 Lite! Merci de me permettre de découvrir cette licence mythique qui ne m'intéressait guerre autrefois ! Je le dévore mon tout premier FF! *EDIT* Je suis désormais sur un XIAOMI CC9.

This remake has always been kind of ugly looking, with washed out sprites and horrible menus, but at least it was serviceable. With the latest update, the whole game is badly stretched and blurred on 19:9 screens, with no option to adjust the screen ratio or the borders. Basically unplayable.
Great game very very bad controls
It 100% crashed, after got Cyan and controled Shadow into camp. Fix it please, I really want to play this game.

Editors choice Google play!? The game is broken. Last updated years and years ago. Not compatible with android 10..... Senior teams need to contact square Enix for update reports or simply remove game from your store front.
Was working fine, now it won't get past signing into Google Play.
It's only FFVI ladies and gentlemen!!! My only real concern is when is SE going to release a remake of what this game was always meant to be.

This is one of the very best Final Fantasies. The characters, the story and the music are amazing and bring back beautiful childhood memories. I'm having a blast playing it again. Thankfully, it runs smoothly on my Galaxy 10 phone. My only complaint is that the walking controls are very clumsy and drive me nuts. Other than that, it's a perfect game.

I bought this on release day and have played it twice through on a few different phones without issue. I don't mind the sprites or the controls at all and the music, story, and characters are all outstanding. A lot of negative reviews seem to come from people playing this on ancient phones. I'm replaying it for my third time on a Note 10+ and it's playing just fine.
Other than the touchscreen controls being a bit finicky at times, the overall experience is worth the price of admission.
Love it but... Screen ratio sucks. Won't fill my entire screen. I'm on a Galaxy s10+, running Android 10.0. Please fix this for ALL your games. They all could use Cloud Save as well!
Can't pass an area it crashes everytime no matter which save I load or how I try it. Feeling ripped off
A fun game, but it consistently crashes at a certain point, making it unplayable.
Please update to work on Android 10!!
Crashes at the imperial camp during Sabin's mission.
Cannot play on Android 10
Worth some nostalgia. However the game crashes at multiple points and is basically unplayable on a Galaxy S7 Update: no crashes on Pixel 4
Does not work with most recent Android version
Annoying controls

BUYER BEWARE!! As stated below regardless of device or android version this game has game breaking crashes rendering this game absolutely non playable. I had installed this a few years ago when I purchased my first OG pixel and now have the same issues on my pixel 3A. The last game update was back in February of 2015 so that tells you how lazy the developers are .
THIS GAME IS BROKEN. DO NOT BUY. you get to a certain point in the game and it crashes. As far as I can find online there's no way to get around it. I'm emailing Square for a refund.
Can't even download the game, what a crapshow, can't even get my refund

Disappointing. Interface and controls are clunky. Other FF ports/remakes have done it much better (especially FF3). Also seems to consistently crash on my Z2 Play so I can't even use it any more. Used to work okay on my Droid Turbo. Had to give up and go back to a GBA emu in order to play this title.
Need internet connexion to play...
Great

This game is not compatible with Android 10. You get a warning that it was built for an older version of Android, and sure enough, it gets stuck on a black screen with an endlessly spinning loading wheel.
I wish i had listened to all the reviews about how the game crahes. Mine shuts down in the imperial tent camp after teaming up with shadow.
Game keeps crashing at tent in imperial camp. Unplayable.
It was completely awesome it had the best graphics I have ever seen Lol Andy's says it was great !!!
Game doesn't work on Android 10 (Pixel 3)
Have always loved this Final Fantasy. Was disappointed when I first downloaded a year ago due to the app crashing at certain points but now it runs smoothly.

2 years and the game is still broken. Can't get out of the magitek facility without it crashing. This game should be a 5 star game. Instead it's average is 3.5 due to the sheer number of 1 star reviews due to th unfixed bugs. Do not buy this game. Spend your money on anything else.
idk why ff6 needs to manage my system, since i wont give my life to ff6 i can not even play it
Great game, but a truly awful port with too many bugs.
DO NOT BUY! THIS GAME IS BROKEN! COMPANY KEEPS TAKING MONEY WHILE PROVIDING ZERO UPDATES! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY TILL THEY FIX THEIR BROKEN GAMES!!!!!!

Easily the best game in the entire series. This port? Not as much. I would recommend you play the original SNES version (available, unadulterated, on the SNES Classic if you can't get your mitts on the cartridge) but if that's not possible this might be the best chance you'll get to play this incredible game. The game is a bit clunky in this format but I still can't *not* recommend it.
There is an unskippable bug that makes you unable to complete the game. The game is the best SNES JRPG, so this version being broken is the ultimate blue balls.
The game closes in sabins scenario when you enter the tents outside doma castle! Please fix bug! Paid games should not have these problems!
The game crashes at specific points in the story, making it unplayable.
Please fix the control system, it's so annoying for big thumbs
Now if they'd just put out Xenogears on Android...

Game is known to have a broken issue where the game will crash at several points. Despite everyone's attempts to report this Square ignores these. Do not buy unless you like setting your money on fire
Crashes, cannot continue past vector.

Excellent game. Only gave 3 stars because the navigation system really stinks. Should of left the keypad stationary instead of it being moveable or gave us an option. It goes to say if it ain't broke don't fix it. Otherwise everything else is great. Give us an option so I can give this app 5 stars. Thank you.

Game always breaks in the same spot when going in a tent making it unplayable. Ive looked up the issue on forums and looks like no fix in sight. I would start flaging this game and see if we can get it taken down because they have shown no interest in trying to respond to or fix the bugs for people.
There's a certain part of a certain cut scene, that always, without fail, will crash the game. It's a great game that I've played multiple times, but these released has screwed me.
Crashes if you enter the tents in the imperial camp, which you can avoid, however, you cannot avoid the mandatory cutscene at the research facility. Am unable to progress past that point.

2nd UPDATE: I have now sent square 2 emails at two different addresses. Keep getting auto response asking me to email another address. Useless. UPDATE: sent email to Square. Let's see if they respond. Glitches and shut down. Found 2 places that game shuts off through normal play. 1st time is in tent in the base near Doma. If you go into the tent it shuts off. 2nd place is in the mine cart escape when leaving the magitek factory. can't get past this point. This game has been out how long now?
Amazing game. Fix the fricking save issue. It doesn't ever actually save my progress and I'm surprised I haven't rage quite and broken my phone yet. Mostly problems with the quick save.
I love ff I can't get pass gau the game keeps kicking me off piz help please fix I love this game please let me finish it
Game crashes escaping the empire after kefka pulls the switch. DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS IT GETS UPDATED.
Game is totally broken on Android 10. Won't load at all besides the initial opening. :(

Dont get me wrong the original Final Fantasy 6 is amazing, if you can, find it for gameboy advance or snes. Why why why why why why why why why why would you change the original pixel art to this abomination eyesore? ☹
A timeless classic that I love dearly!
Would give 5 stars if they allowed you to play the game offline. Classic sprites and art style would have been preferred however it does not detract from the gameplay which is still excellent.

I love the game, but unfortunately it's unplayable because of bugs. There support was very responsive and they offered a refund, but i would rather keep the game it goes the fix it. If that happens it would get 5 stars from me.
Fun game, could use an update though
Game crashes at imperial camp Everytime. Apparently it's a common bug that's yet to be fixed. Very disappointed.
Best game in the series. A must play!
Please fix the game it keeps crashing for me for the entire area of Sabin infiltrating the camp
Crashes at points cant get past them.

Unfortunately I never got to play FFVI on its original platform. So this is my first time playing it. I do not like the User Interface, It looks cheap and tasteless. I think it'd be a lot nicer looking if it were more like pixel-esque as opposed to the bubbly appearance it currently has. Other than that I think it's the best Final Fantasy on the Mobile
It was good to be able to play an old classic.
Game closes in the same places other people complain about. You won't be able to refund by the time you find it crashing. I wish I had read the reviews instead of trusting the compatibility
The story is amazing, but you can get that on a rom with better graphics.
Doman castle siege bug. Screen tears causing game to crash. Please fix this. Gonna request a refund if its not fixed soon. Looks like im not the only one upset about this either
Game is great

Please fix it!

This is literally the best final fantasy game in the series. I've been through and beaten it on this port before, and I'm not one of those pretentious people who hates the new "blurry" art or whatever. What made the game great for SNES is all still there. The part that pisses me off is that it crashes at Darrill's Tomb this playthrough. This is clearly a known issue, with other users experiencing the same problem, and yet Square chooses to do nothing about it. They supposedly "escalated" my ticket, with the resulting "solution" being to offer me a tacit "sorry/not sorry" in the form of a refund I don't want. You know what I DO want? The dang game to work. Fix it. It's like a delicious, perfect double stuft Oreo only you go to bite it and you find out someone has already licked all the filling out of it.

I'm disappointed to discover this app cannot be moved to the sdcard. I have purchased all of the main titles available on Android and this is the only one that forces you to use internal memory. While the app isn't particularly large, especially compared to later titles, I would prefer to store it alongside my other games to minimize the amount of space consumed on my device. There is no reason at all why this shouldn't be possible. The only reason it is not is because the developers have set a flag telling the Android system not to allow it be moved from internal storage. Should this change in the future I will update my review accordingly.

This is for the most part the same game many know and love from the SNES, with some bonus content on top of it. The character sprites are amateurish and the movement controls are a bit clunky, but these definitely aren't game-breakers.  Why the 3-star rating then? Because I DID find an inexcusable bug/oversight that can completely prevent progression. SPOILERS AHEAD.  In Cyan's Dream, in the Phantom Train sequence, there's a puzzle involving treasure chests. There's a set of 6 "reference" chests that are either open or closed that you have to match up with a set of 6 "switch" chests in order to progress.   In this port, all 6 reference chests are open, but matching up the switch chests does nothing. Then I tried the arrangement I remember from the original on the switch chests (top-right, bottom-left, and bottom-middle closed), and the door DID open. This basically means that unless you remember the code from the original or look up a guide for the original, you're completely stuck. Even worse, even though Cyan's Dream is optional, if you save inside and don't know the code you could easily be stuck in the dream forever, as there is no way out until it's beaten. THIS HAS TO BE FIXED ASAP.

Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase.

Out of all the Final Fantasy's I've played FF6 has to be my favorite so far! The graphics are top-notch, extremely colorful and totally captivating. The controls are practically flawless (though every time you enter another room you have to restart your characters movement.) The music is fantastic (I dance to it while playing); it has one of my favorite OST to date. The characters/story is extremely well-written and quite a memorable experience (the cast isn't your regular cast of characters; there are some real zany people in this game [Kefka anyone?]) I also highly enjoyed the change of pace halfway through the game when you enter the WoR, and thought the Esper Magicite system to be a well-developed and easy to use part of the game (that helped make the game easier towards the end due to ALL my characters having become mages.) All in all I give this game a solid 5/5; it's one that has really withstood the test of time and is still just a great as when it came out. Only thing I dont like is besides cloud save you can't save a game so you can transfer your saved data (such as coping the game data to an SD card (which I tried to do and it wiped out my game!))

FFVI itself is a masterpiece of storytelling, strategy and challenge, and should be played by everyone.

By my favorite game storyline and plot. Great job with the redefined graphics in the port. Only thing i wasn't fond of is the d pad. A few areas like esper cavern and triangle island were trick but other then that. Worth re purchasing this game.
Only issue is when trying to fish with Celes for Cid no fish appear in the water... All I see is that stupid white bird walking around.
This was the first Final Fantasy game and I bought it when it came out in 1994 and I am glad they kept the original sound track for the game
Navigation is a little rough. But this game has been amazingly transferred to mobile.

Hands down my favorite video game of all time.  And the port couldn't make me happier.  If FFIII for SNES was your jam, then look no further.  Worth every penny for the amazing nostalgia and entertainment value this game provides.
Downloaded the game and tried it out. For a pretty pricey game i couldnt even play offline?!! That ruins the point of getting this game on mobile. So 2 stars.
Has me excited for Final Fantasy XV
Doesn't work developer won't answer
Very good game
The game auto pauses before every battle. Very annoying

This is by far one of the best Final Fantasy games ever crafted. The magicite and Esper system make this game absolutely wonderful, and quite unique from other Final Fantasy games. It's HUGE cast of playable characters, and it's multiple party system make this game astounding. 5 stars is too little for this game. It'd be better to give it 100.
The arrows pad suck really bad but the game play is great
Best FF ever im glad to see it remade on android
Not sure why those who pay cannot play. I'll have to use emulator when traveling.
This game is a pretty good port :)  But right now I am unable to sync my locally saved game with the cloud servers.  It keeps saying it is unable to connect to the cloud server :/
I would like a refund this game continuously force closes on my tablet. I paid a lot of money for a game that I can't even play. I would ask this be dealt with soon.
Only thing i don't  like is the directional pad center moves around screen want option to anchor it more like the snes emulator easier to use fine controls.

The game is great. Only thing I have a complaint about is it needs an internet connection to launch every time.... I understand doing it once in while, like once or twice a month every time is ridiculous.

I purchased this game thinking I would  be playing one of my all-time favorite Final Fantasy games. Everything is here , including some revamped graphics. However; the game suffers from very poor controls. I've tried the 4 way and the 8-way controls. Each lags severely. Also at key points in the game , it can disrupt gameplay. 1 key place is the opera scene. I hate that my experience with this awesome game has been tarnished simply by game controls. And, I honestly wish there was a way to get my money back.

Back when i as a kid this was my favorite game for the snes and it's what got me in to rpg's. So glad I can play it once again. Only down side is you have to have Internet to play which makes no sense they need to do away with that feature.
Im so glad its much easier for us to re-live our childhood memories, than it was for our parents or grandparents.

One of my all-time favourite games. Plays pretty well on mobile, even though you can't really beat the intuitiveness and feel of a d-pad and physical buttons. I recommend playing on a tablet for the best control and handling. I much prefer the original sprites, but with all the updates and improvements made to the overall experience I can't complain too much. Nostalgia wishes some of the original translations had been kept, but updating the translation makes more sense.
Loved this game from way back. Love it even now.
Lmfào
Every time I enter the first battle the game crashes.
Brilliant game but cannot play without internet connection, this game is not free to play. Please remove this feature, I don't care about achievements!

Loved this game when it first came out. UI is pretty easy to pick up. Biggest complaint/deal breaker is that it crashes when I have limited or intermittent network connectivity (like on the subway). Really frustrating when you go to load a game that costs this much and you can't play because it requires a network connection to launch.
One of my favorite rpg of all time, final fantasy 6
Brought back all sort  of nostalgia. Played it for hours through with no lag or problems on lg g3.
Awesome, just awesome..
Can we get an option to hide touchscreen buttons when playing FFVI? I always seem to tap them and exit the game and loose my progress.
A little trouble with the controls, but I love it!!

The classic is reborn with new and updated character models and updates backgrounds.  I am not that far in yet but so far the game is fun and enjoyable.   Some of the text is a little different from the SNES version you might remember but nothing major so far.    The worst part so far is the control pad...it is really hard to get used to and could use some tweaking....perhaps something more along the lines of what Final Fantasy Dimensions contained.   No other complaints, the game game runs well.
Good old school favorite. If you like this series and haven't tried this one you're missing out.
Great job square, again great rpg port with no technical issues.

Since entering Kefka's Tower towards the end of the game, I've noticed that the game constantly hangs right after the Demon boss battle. When the battle is over, the statue disappears then the game crashes. Anyone else experienced this?
Why can't I play this game without the wifi?

A few things.. #1. People have already mentioned that the game should be accessible offline and I definitely agree with this. #2. Is it possible to 'fix' the d-pad rather than having it come up and go away? It would be so much less hassle if it could just stay in a place. With the way it is now, it jumps around and gets extremely annoying! #3. Is there a setting to make the screen not turn off while the game is open? This is also quite irritating and causes the game to crash at times =/

As someone who's 1st Final Fantasy is FFXIV (a great MMO), I decided to go back and play the older FFs. I started with VI and wow! This game is truly amazing with a fantastic story and memorable characters and music. Gameplay is also very fun but you can become overpowered very easily (by spamming a certain spell) and make the game's end a faceroll. If you are even remotely interested in Final Fantasy or RPGs, FFVI is a game you will come to compare even modern RPGs to.

Terrible drm that won't allow you to play without an internet connection. I would have bought all of the ff games but not after finding out that you can't play on a plane. Emulators instead of buying from square from now on...

I really hate that the game will not load while offline. I have to load the game at home and keep it minimized if I want to play while I am out and about. Why is this? So I can get useless experience on my Google play account? Please fix this... I know you won't though
Addictive. Enjoyable. Say goodbye to your free time.

As soon as I enter game, I get a message that reads "Unknown issue,  from Google play". This stops me from being able to access cloud & upload save from my newer phone. This phone stays home & ONLY works through wifi. Everything is up to date.
Beautifully remastered!

I'd  actually rate this port of one of my all time favorites a five if not for the sloppy game  pad. The touch system i like but the option for a fixed  gamepad needs to be added. Just did the quest for Gogo the other day and had the hardest time ever because the pad kept changing places on me.  Also, there's also a section in the dragons den (Great Cavern) I think, that has the same flaw. I must say though  the touch screen blitz prompt for Sabin and the bushido selection for Cyan was a major plus.

The controls are horrible. Trying  to talk to town folk to advance the story is almost impossible  as they move about please fix. 15 bucks? I will never give SE another dime this is one of my favorite  games but should not be played on this port
My all time favorite game
Love playing this on my 4k bravia tv via Google play. Even get ps4 controller support. Square - do this with every phone game you release!

Where is 7 and 8? Seriously though not sure why there's complaints about the dpad not being fixed. If you just push down in the same place and drag to what direction you want to go the dpad will always appear in the same spot. This way just gives you the option to make the dpad appear where ever is comfortable for you. Noice.
Control system kinda sucks but over all it was tite
There's only one tincy problem, we can't download it on this phone.
Such a great game. Definitely in my top three Jrpgs. Solid port too.
Love this game!!! The only critique is the bushido blade- this interface can make it difficult (or my fingers are just too fat😉)
Great game, but bought this to play on a long flight.  Obviously can't do that if it must have internet to start up.  Please fix this!

Don't think this game needs any description. When SE completely descends into the depths of talentless, uncreative, money-grubbing pits of mediocrity they're cheerfully racing towards, they'll still have this game to make them look good. RIP Squaresoft.
This is a very great version of this game good work on making it but the only setback is that it drains battery very quick other than that its great
Probably one of the best final fantasy games that I can carry around in my pocket
Overall I can't come up with a good complaint, bringing back one of my favourite childhood jrpg's just melts my heart. 5/5 nostalgia stars
I really love the game, it looks beautiful and for a first time for me on this game was a great experience, I would rate it a  5 star if it could support controllers like moga or nvidia shield
Epicness
One of the best rpgs
It's the best final fantasy game ever and it's just as good on mobile and has good graphics
Loved the new auto battle feature, better than the original!
Game is amazing, but the controls for mobile are pretty awful: various parts of the game require fast reaction / precise movements that are almost impossible with the provided controls.
Love this game was my first final fantasy
Game looks great but the controls are so bad it's not worth playing! Save your money and chose another game that you can actually enjoy playing!

Hi I played through this Android version the first day it was released and now I am noticing the latest version which I recently installed only to discover a different Dpad than what i used last time. I also noticed the option under config to select keypad 1 or keypad 2. Mine is the same with either selection. Anybody help to return to original DPad?
My favorite FF game ported to my phone.
Out of all of the SNES era ports that I've played on droid, this is by far the best. Definetly worth the price of admission for long time final Fantasy fans.
Good game, but you must be online to start it. Bad to find out when you try to play at the start of a long flight...

Just one issue ,i have a problem start up wise ..like why do i have to have a network connection for the game just to start up it should be able to start up offline without the need for a connection please fix this ,as for the rest of the game its great brings me back to super nes days and then foward to todays technology ,a very good looking game
Great to see it's finally working with cloud save and Nvidia Shield support.  Some minor weirdness control wise but a great game otherwise.
Everything you expected, and a little bit more!

Always wanted to experience this game and now I finally get to on a touchscreen!!! The cloud save is an awesome feature! I can play seamlessly with more than one device. The game has awesome music. Only problem w the game is that I wish thr graphics were morr consistant. Either redo all the graphics one way, or leave it.
Bought this for a plane trip and couldn't play without an internet connection. Enjoy the $6, you'll never get another dime from me.
Can't be the great older games
Just keeps coming up Connection lost and can't open  I payed good money for this and it should work flawlessly  and should be able to pay with out Internet connection    FIX THIS NOW  😠

I have no idea why, but this game consumes a *ton* of battery.  It even seems to use battery even while it's in the background, unless you force close.  Combined with the DRM that requires an Internet connection to play, and you may have trouble getting this game to run on wi-fi only devices while travelling.
The game runs great on the Nvidia Shield Tablet with the Nvidia controller.  I have to give it 4 stars due to occasional crashes.  I'm running Android 6.0 with no modifications.

The game is great in every way, except in a few areas. My characters have been losing their stats. Cyan had a strength of 130, then went back to 94. Locke's stats will not improve at all. Fix this and I will rate higher.

I'm confused about why people say this is the bast game on the series. The characters don't have detailed stories, replayed music for towns, the bosses are easy, etc. I enjoy it because I like rpg but it's definitely not the best final fantasy. I still like ff9 and ff10 better. I'm rating the game but honestly on the Android two stars because the control pad is hard to get use to. I had to do the opera scene several times because of it and it's so hard to talk to NPC because of it.
Besides the controls, I love this game!

D-pad is not good. It's too big and doesn't disappear immediately when we remove our finger from the screen. It's really frustrating at times. Wayward Soul is much better in that respect. It's easily fixed and I hope they will do it. Battle control are not perfect either, but good enough. Drains a LOT of battery. Overall it's still very enjoyable. My favorite FF of all time! The game by itself is 5 stars. The port, only 4 stars, which saddens me. I want to give 5, but honestly can't. Still recommended!
While I was in my first major boss battle, not cool...
good game but 4 hours in a glitch meant i had to restart it from scratch

I just finished ff4 and ff5 on android and both were good.  Ff6, the on screen controller is much more clumsy feeling than 4 or 5.  My other major complaint is that it crashes when you try to open it while offline.

Currently not working. When I load the game up, it says it requires a data download in order to run and suggests downloading on WiFi. So I connect to my WiFi network and start downloading, but it never does anything. It keeps starting and stopping, never gaining any progress. I had this game for over a month now, and I never experienced this problem before now. I literally cannot get the game to launch. So disappointed.

Not very far into the game yet but it doesn't take long to notice how bad the controls are. I have been playing FFV and the controls are amazing. Then to come to this its a real shock. Besides the controls it looks great. Fix the controls and I'd give 5 stars.
Always online a big let down for an old game
Adapted as effectively as it could be.
The on-screen D-Pad is just horrible and its pointless to try and play while I'm out and about. Good thing it has bluetooth controller support or I would have wasted my money.

- Crashes each time it is opened and so all my progress is technically lost. + So far though, it had a great plot and was definitely enjoyable... hopefully this issue is resolved so that I can continue to play.  Otherwise, I would have given this game five stars.
Hands down, the best "pre-3d" Final Fantasy game. This happens to be the best version of the game too. Simply put....a Mobile Masterpiece.
Great port. I would like the option to use the original graphics, but otherwise I love the full-featured product - cloud saving, Android TV, and gamepad support. Thanks!

This is a great port of FFVI! It has all of the awesomeness of the original and more, with achievements making it even more challenging and fun. The quick save feature helps when issuse arise with your phone. The app crashes from time to time, most frequently when Gau returns from learning rage techs in the Veldt, wasting a lot of valuable time when trying to do so. Other than that, great game!

I am really enjoying the simplicity and upgrades to the mobile version of this game. It makes playing on the fly very easy. I also enjoy the autosaves, and cloud save features.  Auto battle really helps when grinding or at a time when you can't monitor your screen.  The new menu and battle menu are so much easier to use than an emulator.  And contrary to a lot of people, i actually enjoy the new sprites, and am not letting nostalgia goggles block that. They are nice.  Thanks SE
Buy it if you like RPG'S
Great game
Great integration to a mobile device.  The format is great and easy to use.  Loved it way back when and love it now.
Borrowed the SNES version about 15 years ago & never got to complete all the side quests. Happy to finally get the chance to finish this wonderful game, even if it doesn't offer offline play.
It works perfectly, though I'm not very fond of the saving system. Anyway, this is FFVI as good as it gets.
What more could you ask for?
Can't install on samsung galaxy tab?
Played this on the snes way back in the day; Too good to not play it again on my phone.

Plays amazing, and looks great. This phone can handle any game on the market.

I absolutely loved this game on the SNES and now I love it on Android.
This game is best classic rpg ever made

Still a blast after many years

I buy this every time it is released! This is the best FF. It is hard to convince those who began playing FF's post SNES and never gave it a try. The music is still amazing and the characters show so much emotion for being so little. The diagonal movement is a nice feature, but sometimes makes controlling movement with Sprint Shoes a little harder. This game is worth every dollar and I'd buy it again if it was made for the new consoles!
My favorite game of all time. I don't even care that the sprites look dumb.

FFVI easily ranks high on my list of my favorite games of all time. I don't know how many times I've played through it in the past, but it definitely a game I can play over and over so I had to buy this. My first impressions of this port are extremely positive. The graphics look great and I love that you can play it entirely and comfortably with one hand. Easily one of the better Final Fantasy games. I couldn't recommend this more.
Great
This is a must for every jrpg gamer

Why does it check the Internet once a day? It crashes if you don't have access. Once it checks, you can use it offline but eventually it wants to phone home again. And then you're screwed if you don't have data.
Nostalgia over 9000. Love this version. Just need IX ❤
Love the game and the graphics look great. The only flaw is the on screen controls. Just awful. Forget about wearing sprint boots.

Ff 6 (3) is by far one of my favorite games of all time. So this bad review hurts me a little. The d-pad is useless beyond useless. It is only seen when you touch the screen, and if you lift your finger even a little it moves, making one space movement really hard. Wish I could get my money back.

amazing!!!!!

My favorite game of all time! Used to have to rely on emulators to play on the go, but this new version is fantastic so far. No issues whatsoever, I'm loving everything about it. Clouds saves are great. Kind of bothered by the need for a connection to play, how can I kill time in the woods if the game won't initiate? (2013 Moto X, Fire Phone CM11)

Love the game since SNES version. However, there is a bug during battle scene. Whenever I input attack command and select any enemy in a battle, my screen goes partiality black. I can still hear sound and I can touch battle options, but I don't see what I'm hitting. Please fix. Someone has already reported this very same bug on other SQ-ENIX games like FF dimensions earlier.

I'll start off by saying I've played this game ALOT at different points in my life, so it is a great game for sure. If you have the option to, I'd say play it on snes, gba, or emulation of one of those. The movement is so stiff and I'm not sure I'll fully get used to it. The movement pad will 'stick' on screen for a few seconds after you let go while trying to adjust, so it is very anti user friendly. I played ff3, ff4, and ff5 without any qualms about their movement system, so not sure why they changed ff6

This is my favorite game, yet the controls are blocky and the lag on movement is horrible, I'm to the end of the world of balance about 17hrs of gameplay and I still have not been able to get adjusted to the controls, I feel bad for first time players especially for parts that are timed like the Opera scene/ultros I had to redo 2x myself considering it's impossible to not run into/avoid enemies and even worse walls because of the movement controls. Furthermore, controls+sprint shoes=WORSE FIX PLEASE
Everything is amazing , but the lack of offline.
I bought the game cuz im a huge fan and everytime i try to open it it says that an error has occured... Then it shuts down... Can you please help me...?

I've played all but the two NES games that weren't originally released in the US... This one is the best. Great story, awesome characters, a VERY hateable villian... Be ready to spend a ton of hours with this game!
Great game, a bit on the easy side. Minus 1 Star for horrible touch screen controls, especially moving around with the pad.

The game is very enjoyable. There are some MAJOR problems though. Sabins blitz commands aren't in the game. And the game freezes is Thamasa. Has anyone gotten past this? Without spoiling anything it's right when Kefka says "illusion". Cyan is actually useful now because you don't have to wait while he charges. You select the command and he waits while you can give your other characters commands. The control out of battle is a bit weird. Fix the freezing issue and I'll give it a 5 star.  *Fixed bugs.
It actually works well for the confines of playing on a phone.

Would definitely give 5stars if screen didn't go black when u enter battle commands. PLEASE fix this dev!!!!!!! I absolutely love this game but that makes me sad when I can't even watch the battle and the cool effects. I think a lot of fan reminisce in that ya know?
Awesome game.  Looks like the updated FF4/After Years on PSP.  If you liked that versions updated graphics.  You will not be disappointed.  SE!!  Please put FF12 on android.

I played this when it first came out and probably twenty times after in various forms and platforms.. I love this game. It got me hooked into fantasy as a kid. The story is great and the Suttle yet enhanced graphics is nice.

The largest issue by far, and the reason this game loses at least 2 stars for me is the inability to play offline. This is a single player game... why does it require an online connection to play? Love this game as much as ff7 and ff10. Beautifully redone but can u plz fix the dpad. Mine constantly shifts and will not lock in place. Fix that and Def get 5 stars square. Ps also add a full screen.

...and that is a fairly large number. Each of the many characters has an excellent back story. The best game music ever! Excellent graphics update. Really well done! Having avoided FF completely over the years,  I thought I'd buy it because a billion ppl can't be wrong... So after 20 mins...  I can't believe ppl waste their lives (and money) on this.   I'm truly worried for the future of the human race.
My favorite final fantasy of all time. So much to do and great gameplay to boot. Beat it on snes ps and many emulators. Saw it here n had to have it!!!!!

Quick trick i used to do back in 1994...use "vanish" then "doom" in that order on monsters...even bosses...all and any of them. It will kill everything in one hit! Your welcome. Great game. I wished it fit my screen like the others do. Dont be thrown off its not 3-d like 3 and 4...this actually looks better. I am yet to find any complaints.
A good remake of a classic
The game actually sucks waste of time and money. Not that I am planning top pay for this game but you get the point

I've tried on and off for around a month now to enjoy this game, but the dpad or whatever it's called sucks. I could only play it to the first save area and then i had to stop playing it for fear i would break my phone. I would like a refund.
Old but fun
Won't let me play on my tablet unless I'm on wifi.  What a joke.  Not buying any square games again

userName: คุณชายเดียว
content: This is the best Final Fantasy series ever I ever been played on SNES and PS1 when I was young until now it's come to moblie phone! I bought and play immediatly!
You need to be connected to play! Impossible to launch the game otherwise. Unacceptable for the price!! You can't even play when you want to.

I bought this game so I could play it on a 16 hour road trip, but for whatever reason Square decided to pull an EA Games and require an internet connection for a single player game. Final Fantasy VI is an amazing game, too, so it's a shame that I'm rating it so low. I will give more stars when you come to your senses and get rid of the DRM.

this has been my favorite game ever since it's SNES release. I've been waiting for this port!  I believe this game to be criminally underrated as it is oft overshadowed by the accolades of it's lil bro, FF7, so the younger fans usually neglect to give this one a second look.  here, they've completely retouched all of the artwork so everything looks more crisp on these screens.  the BRILLIANT music remains in tact. the on-screen controls are quite wonky but a Bluetooth controller fixes that. solid A, guys.
Just love this game played when I was young and now on phone f#%&#%# cool man

I've bought this game on 4 times already on different consoles but I've played and beat six versions of the game including the Japanese original release. Without a question this is one of the best RPGs ever made and worth every penny.
R.p.g.

I seem to break all my 'game purchase rules' when it comes to this series. Been playing since I was 6 and now I'm near 34 and still search for different versions and everytime they release a new one. I would like to see a new one released with a gaming structure of an older release with focus on core gaming and ignore a few of the bells and whistles. 2, 3, 7, 8, 10 & 12 still seem to be the best ones. Keep up the great work and if you could release the need for internet connection that would be fantastic.
Demand refund , crashes on 1st battle

Started over on my TV via the NVIDIA Shield.  Was a big fan of the original on the SNES but stopped when that girl wakes up on the island.  I'm lovin' it! Seriously im tired of the game slowing down or stopping because of the being a lack of mobile data or internet.  It dosent need that function. I give it 4 stars because the controller is very difficult. The story of the game is brilliant, masterpiece soundtrack by Nobuo Uematsu, gameplay and system is good enough. I like the graphics is being improved from the previous version (snes and psone)

Upgraded my rating now that all of the bugs appear to be fixed! The game and story are my favorite of any role-playing game (RPG) ever but it crashed so much before that I had to downgrade my rating. So glad they fixed it so that I can boost the rting again! Cheers!
Can't wait for 7!!!
One of my all time favorites.  Thanks for adapting it to android.

Pros: It's Final Fantasy 6! The story and music are as great as they ever were. The higher-resolution sprites are nice, though the character sprites on the field map look a little too much like Bratz dolls to me. The touch controls and UI changes for the touch screen are pretty good. Supports a controller.  Cons: It hogs the CPU unnecessarily. It pegs the CPU 100% even when you switch to another app, even when FF6 is left on the title screen. This causes my phone to get hot and reduces the battery life to just a few hours. There is no excuse for this, I have a modern phone with good battery life (Sony Xperia Z3 Compact) and the game should not be taxing.  The game also has an obnoxious phone-home feature. I purchased this for an international flight without wifi. Before leaving, I tried it in Airplane Mode and it started up and played. I didn't play it again until the flight home two weeks later,  when it refused to work in Airplane Mode. I was able to get it to work by enabling wifi and connecting to the in-flight network, then disabling wifi once it tried to connect. Don't treat your paying customers like criminals!

A terrible port of a fantastic game. FFVI easily stands as one of the best RPGs (if not games) of all time, so I don't need to the same things that people have been saying for over 20 years. While I'm glad to have been able to play this game on the go and definitely appreciated the cloud save feature, this port is dreadful. Forget the missed opportunity that was a FFIII/IV-style remaster - the ridiculous D-pad made me want to throw my phone against a wall, and the dodgy targeting system resulted in me casting Arise on perfectly healthy characters. Pressing any random spot during a battle counts as a press for the default target, so if you slightly miss a character's name, you're doing whatever action you've selected on the currently highlighted target. This would be less forgivable on an inferior game.

The best Final Fantasy, but some bugs from the original have been fixed and new bugs introduced.  The Vanish > Doom and Gau Merit Award exploits have been fixed as well as the evasion stats now function as the stat screen shows.  (In the original, the physical and magical evasion stats were programmed poorly and didn't operate as intended.)  The crash issues some people are reporting have been fixed for the Nexus 7.  However the game crashes each time you cast Banish (called X-Zone in the original game). The touch screen can be kind of awkward but not horrible.  Moving with the touch screen can be erratic which makes time-sensitive missions a little more difficult.  Finally, it does require internet access to play, which can be annoying.

A little worried that Square won't update the compatibility of this (or any Final Fantasy games) for ART in the upcoming Android L release.  If any of the Square reps are reading these reviews, can you give us any  info here?  Leaving 3 stars until I see ART compatibility.  Edit Oct 8th, 2014:  Another thing that needs attention from Square Enix is that there is NO way to back up your saved games on an unrooted phone.  Thats a pretty big inconvenience to anyone changing phones, especially if they don't want to repeat the hours and hours of progress they made.  Taking away another star until is this addressed, and no movement on ART compatibility with Android L coming down the pipe is also a concern......   March 12, 2015 - ART compatibility and cloud saves!

Final Fantasy VI is, hands down, one of the best FF titles made. And this remake isn't as terrible as some make it out to be... It'd be a 4-5 effort if it wasn't for one thing: online requirements. It needs to authenticate with servers at least once a day, or it can't be played... Which makes no sense to me, as there's no online component apart from cloud saving as far as I see. This makes it pretty much unplayable without a constant connection, and just reeks of some of the worst DRM practices. You know - the kind that do the opposite of discouraging piracy, given that the illegitimate copies out there can actually be played without users jumping through hoops...

A great game, PERIOD.

Ok, so there are two things S-E did right with this:   1. The backgrounds look amazing.   2. The music sounds pretty good.  And now the laundry list of complaints.   1. The menus are UGLY.  You'd think with the vast amount of resources S-E has at their disposal, they could have designed a slicker UI with a better font.   2. The new translation is bland.  It may be more literal, but Woolsey's take was more fun.   3. The virtual stick.  Probably the single worst and most distracting thing about this port.  PC adventure game developers figured out how to move a character around in a 2D environment long ago, Square-Enix.  Just tap the ground where you want to walk, or tap the object or NPC you want to interact with.  Is that so hard?    4. The app has to phone home to launch.  Actually, THIS is the worst thing about this game.  Come on, Squeenix. I paid 15 smackers for this half-assed port, and I can't even play it with the phone on airplane mode?  I really wanted to believe, but I just can't hack it anymore.  I can't understand how SE managed to make this a less pleasant experience than playing the original with SNES9X on my phone, but mission accomplished.

Played this game on and off over the years. It has a good story that's paced and delivered well, especially for its time. Game play is simple and solid. Lots of things to find and do, special items that are worth hunting down, and characters that you need to coax into joining your fight. And finally, one of the best villains ever. Kefka is a nice believable twist on the insane bad guy. He wasn't always that way... he was made that way.
My favorite FF game now on my Android with updated graphics. Exactly what I wanted.
One of my favorite games, now on my tablet, HURRAH!

Good Stuff: - Smoother graphics - Controls fully adapted for touchscreen devices. Even Sabin's Blitz is cool to play it on this touchscreen interface. - Cloud save in case you need to replace your mobile. (Bonded to your g+ account) - New sections and Functionality (Bestiary, Album, Play Music, Achievements)  - Fast-forward button for battles. - Now there's no need to be connected to the Internet in order to play.  Bad Stuff: - Directional Pad on maps is kind of annoying. When I separate my finger from the screen, the directional pad is still there for at least 1 sec, so when I put my finger again on the screen (thinking that is a "new" direc. pad centered on my new finger position), I accidentally touch an arrow of the directional pad that didn't disappear right after I lift my finger.  - No cinematics. I was hoping game included PS1 videos.  But game is worth every single penny. Now I can play my favorite FF game on my HTC ONE :)

I am now stuck at the bridges in the Dragon's Den, because touch screens are not equipped to handle that type of movement well.

The ability to save game progress to a cloud is a necessity for an rpg such as this. I buy a new phone every year and I cannot play from previous saved games from other phones. I will no longer purchase any more square games until this issue is fixed. I have already purchased 5 of the final fantasy fames already released for android.

While missing a bit of the charm of the original SNES version, or the PS1 port, this is easily the best Final Fantasy made. The crowning jewel of the achievements of Square Enix. Nothing else adds up, compelling characters and an engaging story, allow me to forget the flaws of this port and just enjoy a fantastic classic RPG.

This is one of the greatest games of all time. Personally, I like the updated graphics. I think the environments are a lot sharper and look better. Playing the game on a HD display is really a treat. That said, the frame rate stutters in a lot of places. A 2D game shouldn't do that on a top tier tablet (Galaxy Note 10.1 2014 edition). In addition like the other Final Fantasy Android ports, there's no cloud save support. I love playing the game on my tablet, but I would really love to be able to continue from the same save on my phone when I'm on the go.  I still love the game though, and I'm glad it's on Android. Hopefully,  Final Fantasy 7 is in the future.

Please Square Enix, follow googles lead and implement their cloud saving framework in your games.

FFVI is a fun game. For the most part, this game is what you expect. There are two main problems, one that is glaring and makes me regret buying the game. The first problem is somewhat small but rather annoying. Because it is on a tablet, Square Enix opted to provide an odd d-pad control that makes navigating difficult. It certainly takes getting used to and even then the control is simply not intuitive. Fortunately enough, most traveling is not time sensitive or nothing will ever get done!  The second problem is the big one. In order to play the game, Square Enix requires the player to be connected to the internet to make sure that the copy of FFVI is valid. This is super frustrating, because I bought this game for my tablet, which I want to play while I'm traveling. This validity check makes this impossible! Square Enix needs to find a better way to make this check. For this reason, I have to keep the score low until Square Enix fixes this.

I don't get the negative ratings here. The graphics are beautiful, slick combat controls, and movement is NOT bad once you are used to it. The blue bars on the side are not even noticeable, at least on my g2. Awesome purchase.

On top of that, no cloud support and unlike other FF games, it DOES NOT allow to backup data, meaning you can't transfer saves with Helium. Why take away this small thing? More draconian DRM?

Final Fantasy VI, the best game in the series, has a new home on Android. It is the pinnacle of the JRPG genre, with many memorable characters and an engaging storyline.  The reworked controls work very well, and the new sprites, while somewhat controversial, seem appealing to me.  Unfortunately, this version of the game doesn't have the legendary Woolsey translation, but that's a nitcpick.  I recommend this game to tablet users and fans of the JRPG genre.

Honestly the game probably deserves 5 stars, but I can't seem to give it 5 stars for what I think are two issues.  First, the game has to have internet connectivity to start.  For someone who lives in NYC and plays on the subway that kind of sucks (I have found a workaround where I either need to open the game before going underground, or turn off the mobile data and the wifi on my phone. But I really dont want to have to do that EVERY single time I'm on the subway.  I can easily forget to re-enable one or the other when I get off the Subway.) I could understand that being an issue if the saved game data was stored in the cloud someplace.  The other issue is the flying the airship with the onscreen dpad makes it almost impossible to control.  That being said I do love graphics and the game play.    I would probably give the game 5 stars if they did something about the internet connectivity thing or decided to store the saved game data in the cloud and on the device.

Xperia Z Ultra. Great game ported brilliantly to mobile. This is essentially the GB Advance version with slightly updated graphics and optimised for HD. Looks and runs flawlessly on this phone. I've been waiting for a remake of this game for years and am glad to see they went this route.  Yes, the sprites are very similar to the snes counter parts - and why shouldn't they be?  There are high-rez sprites, high-rez backgrounds, and great spell effects.  All of which can be seen better if your tablet has an hdmi out to connect to a large screen tv.  I have no complaints about the controls, they work great on my Evga Tegra Note 7.  This is if you enjoyed the best game ever and want to play it on a newer device with updated graphics.  Think hard about what the snes graphics were like and how they look on a lcd/led screen, it's worse than you remember.  This new version is great! This is a well thought out smartphone iteration of what is largely regarded to be the best classic Final Fantasy. It runs really smoothly (60fps on my Moto X), has some great menu design whereby you don't have to send a party member's command to the back of the queue anymore, and decent touch controls. The new sprites look better on a smaller screen too, and they retain some of the great emotions from the SNES original. I was sceptical at first, but I'd say this edition ranks above the GBA port.

While this is a beautifully-rendered game, I am surprised that it lacked the cg cut scenes that were added in previous versions of FF games, which makes me question how truly different this is from the ports onto emulators for the game which are so easy to find (and free).   I also suspect many gamers like myself lack 3g/4g, and because when I travel (about once a month by plane) I often have no access to even wifi, I cannot play the game because of Square's insistence on being online to boot up the game. If piracy is a reason for this decision, with no gameplay changes or real add-ons in terms of items or weapons, are the differences between this and ported version that different?   After reading the reviews since the game's release, the most commonly reported complaint is a lack of an option for a fixed d-pad. While this is irritating it doesn't irk me to the point where I don't want to play the game, however, I am disappointed, and feel Square only listens to the reviews when the issue is game-critical. Super sad face for such a beautiful game.
Excellent port. A couple issues, but they are few and far between. Highly recommended for any final fantasy fan.

I've loved this game since I was a kid, and I have to give it 5 stars because it's an all-time great. But why is Square-Enix making changes to battle mechanics during updates? I downloaded this app for my phone the first day it came out, and played through normally with no problems. Normally, in this version and all versions prior, when Gau selects a Rage, he has a 50/50 chance of using Attack or Special every single time it's his turn. It was working perfectly until this latest update. Now, Gau uses Attack 100% of the time on his first turn using a Rage. This completely negates his value as a party member, and I don't understand why this change was randomly and underhandedly made, via an app update! Please correct this Square-Enix; you had it right the first time.
