I assume that if I'm on a plane, I can't play it.  Not cool for people who have legitimately purchased this product.  The only other real complaint I have is the lack of a fixed d-pad. This tends to cause problems when trying to talk to people who are moving, or when you move from one screen to another, you cannot continue walking.  You have to lift your finger up, then put it down, then move it in the direction you wish to keep walking.  The game is still playable, but it's always jarring when it goes against the control schemes of every JRPG before (and after) it.

It's really a shame that the gaming media's response to this remake has been so negative based solely on subjective issues with the graphics, because it actually plays great.  Aside from updated visuals, which I actually think look pretty good in motion, you get (finally) corrected item and spell names in the new translation, the additional content from the GBA version, the (outstanding) original music from the SNES version, plus some welcome changes to the Esper interface and Cyan and Sabin's special abilities.  And underneath it all, still one of the greatest console RPGs ever made.  Yes there are bugs, it's a mobile release with hundreds of possible platforms, bugs happen.  Don't let that or the visual changes scare you away.  If you've never played this game or you're just looking for a nostalgic pass at a classic, this is a must-have.
Edited: Well, after sending you an email of that screenshot, and restarted the game, there was indeed a auto quick save for me to load and it was right at entering that cavern! Awesome job guys!

The FFV port was amazing, and made me hopeful to see my favourite FF come out. But on my phone at least (HTC Sensation XL), it is basically unplayable. The game lags too much. My quick-save after the third battle reads 6 minutes - I started gameplay at 20 minutes. 6 minutes of in-game time = 20 minutes of real-time. That's terrible. The title drop lags. My button pushes at the title screen are delayed. The help file unlike FFV is now a browser link. There is a typo in the first scene of the game, 'espier' rather than 'esper'. The old window patterns that were in the original game are gone, replaced with generic colour schemes. The menu itself is of less detail and polish compared to prior smartphone releases. Button presses are delayed in-game. Battle transitions take forever, as does waiting for sprites to appear. I cannot receive a refund - in the time I was trying to play the game within the "6 minutes" it told me I had played, my 15 minutes of refund time had elapsed. This is absolutely inexcusable - FFV ran fine, NO reason this shouldn't. The screen resolution is not optimised for Android - there are black borders on the sides. Square, I am -very- disappointed. Fix this.

If you find yourself running into random reboots while playing this game go into Settings and disable the Google Location service. Once I did this the game no longer randomly reboots.  The one thing that takes a while to get used to was the 8 point D-Pad which at first I hated but now I really like it. For those who do not like it you can change it to the 4 point D-Pad which is closer to the SNES controls. I'm really enjoying the way this port was done too, the battle system works insanely well and has to be the best of the Android ports I have used so far.  As a huge fan of the SNES release I enjoy the fact that the graphics are as close to the original as possible. I always liked the original graphics and I am glad to see them refreshed but not completely redone.  You cannot go wrong picking this one up.

FFVI has been my favorite Final Fantasy title (and one of my favorite games overall) for many years now, and this Android port is a great way for a new generation of gamers to experience this classic. The characters may have slightly different body forms, but the faces are instantly recognizable, their outfits are more detailed, and you get used to the change quickly. The remastered environments are gorgeous, and highlight how detailed a game this has always been, pushing limits of sound and vision on SNES.

Though I didn't play the original and can't critique it to the original like many before me, the game was fun and the story was an exciting rollercoaster ride of emotions makin me giggle and getting me to know every character (no wonder it's a cult classic in some eyes). I see many complaining about problems running the game, I just bought my LG-v500 and the game ran smoother than a knife through butter so I can't relate , sorry. Gameplay wise, I found the game a tad too easy for my liking, I know it was remade to be more of an experience and less grindy, but when I can beat the majority of the bosses in 4 hits, it doesn't give me the thrill and feel I usually get when I work hard to beat a boss that I've come to know playing FF's. Now controls, not gonna lie they take some getting used to, the 8-way movement is finicky (I know you can change it to 4-way in options, it didn't help) the battle system's touch controls were fine to get around and the autofight button elevated the hassle of frantically tapping every fight, Sabins blitz, really not a big hassle everyones making it out to be, not hard to figure out. All in all a good game with its ups and downs that I happily recommend.

Great game but graphically a mess. A lot of clipping issues in the game as well as transparency errors.  The controls are a pain and don't feel fluid. Battle mechanics seem off and certain bosses feel nerfed.

Some art assets are remade in HD, some are only scaled and filtered. That kind of sucks. Original sound and music, but with a noticeably higher bitrate. Battle system has been streamlined with auto battle and command memory, alters the gameplay a little bit and makes certain characters more feasible choices. The port's technical aspects is where things get ugly: day-one game stopping bugs (soon to be fixed so bravo for that), high input delay, and poor performance for midrange-and-down devices.

I'm enjoying the nostalgia, the storyline stands the test of time.  I'm hearing a lot of complaints about the washed out sprites, but I like them (granted it's been a number of years since I've played FFVI and seen the original sprites).  I am disappointed with the lack of sound controls.  I've wanted to listen to my audio book while playing, and can find no independent controls for the game.  I also find the controls difficult to get used to.  The location of the "joystick" depends on where you touch the screen, but doesn't persist through screens.  If you walk through a door into a different room, your joystick moves to a different position.  Also, it is very difficult to talk with fast moving NPCs due to the controls.

First off this is my fifth time trying to type up my review, so I will keep this short. Great game, it brings back wonderful memories. This is a must buy if you love this style of game. The controls are far too loose, it is hard to get my toon to even get in line to open a chest without going back and forth a few times toget the alignment correct. This delightful revision of one of the greatest of a great series provides incredible high rez artwork that helps bring the game alive. Why does a menu need to be complicated by mandatory gestures! Completely inferior to the original controls, and so inaccurate as to be rage inducing. Lastly, typos in the dialogue? Really?! Absolutely no care went into making this game, this was a shameful cash in.

It could do with some better controls,  even using the ui from ff5 would be an improvement.  That aside,  the game is a bit crisp which may appeal to some and upset others,  I enjoy it,  but it does not feel like it used to.
This game could not run better on my s4 running 4.3. My favorite FF from snes is back! FF3/FF6(Japan) beautifully restored. Best one of the series!
Great game. Runs perfectly on my Nexus 4. Only complaint would be the joystick. The way they have it in Final Fantasy IV is much better.

Great game . The sprites are done just right in my opinion.  The upgrade in graphics is great and really adds to the immersive feel of the game.  One star loss for not being able to backup saves or play one save on multiple devices .  I use the Helium app but it is disallowed for FFVI. Developers please allow Helium permission to read app data. Thank you! Previous FF games have been allowed. Thanks
The game is a classic, and worth playing for any fan of the genre. However the lack of save-game syncing across devices and crazy battery consumption are strikes against this port of the game.
Awesome game. One of the best of the series.   Only gripe is the direction pad is pretty terrible.

Terrible screen optimization on my galaxy s4 over an inch of the left and right side of the screen is black fix this issue. there is no need for this poor screen usage. Devs to lazy to code to auto optimise the resolution based on device worst black borders out of all the games
Bliss
Great game. Runs great on galaxy s4. Only minor complaint is with the touch controls; when walking around the diagonal is really easy to bump

Works great on my HTC One with Android 4.3.    This is the first time (to my knowledge) that the game has been reworked.  There was the GBA version with the same graphics and really awful, out-of-tune music, and the PSOne version that loaded really slowly, but nothing that beat the original SNES version (or virtual console on Wii).  That day has come - a great re-make.  The same art direction, but updated with high resolution character sprites, backgrounds, and portraits.  An intuitive touch-driven menu.  The same perfect music - honestly sounds just like the SNES, which is a little unsettling at first.  A great translation (RIP Ted Woolsey).    The only bummer is that it wont' keep my screen awake. I had to touch the screen to keep my phone from sleeping and doing so skipped the intro credits. Love that version of the song.

I dont understand why everyone is complaining. I played the original years ago when it first came out and I love the updated graphics, very sharp and clean the controls are very good. For what you are getting the price is reasonable

As with the earlier ports this is a perfect game. The only thing missing is an in game volume control. This is important because I like to listen to podcasts while playing. Other wise perfect game. UPDATE taking off another star, the moving directional pad is hard to control, an option for a static d pad is needed. SE just use the same configs as FFV.
Awesome to have final fantasy vi for android and not hating the graphics that people are all hating about. You guys will always have something to complain about I swear

This game works perfectly on my Samsung Note 10.1 (2014) with Jellybean 4.3 OS. This is my favorite JRPG of all times. The game definitely looks better than when I played this on my SNES back in the 90's. Thank you Square!

This is definitely a 5 star game.   The animations, enemies, and backgrounds are flawless.  I also appreciate the old character art being used for the character portraits. However, there are some glaring flaws that I deducted stars for.   The character models are too bright and clean.  They would have benefited from some grittiness or dark outlines to break up their forms as well as a darker color palette.   There was also some slight slow down on my GS3 during text and combat.
Black screen after title...dissappointed...

Please upgrade the art with more shading it's looks too washed out, and please update the screen to where it takes up the whole screen.  If you put more effort in to these ports you will get more out of them.  There is no way for the sprite to not be the best on the market unless your in serious financial trouble square.  If your serious about your price tag then make the game look and play better than the other 3$ apps on the market.	Your Square Enix not an indie studio stop being lazy.
This is a good update to an amazing game. I ,for one, like the new graphic style and think its much better than a 3D version. I wish they wouldn't have dumbed down the dialogue however.
Omg finally! !
Been waiting and waiting my favorite final fantasy comes to android!!! Great music, great classic gameplay amazing simply amazing!! A must have!

There is a Type-O right in the begining storyline: "Espier" instead of "Esper". It takes a bit too long to transition into battles, and the "Battle Speed" option in the configuration menu is BROKEN. The speed of battle stays the same no matter what setting you change it to. You always have to play on the default speed which is, in my opinion, painfully slow. The 'Auto-Battle' option doesn't even speed up battle like it did in FFV. BATTLES ARE TOO SLOW. I feel like I'm constantly waiting for no reason.

Love the game but seems like there is some lag and slowdown.  Droid maxx, I have art disabled but still seems to lag some. Will adjust rating if it gets better. If anyone has idea as that would be great also. On kitkat if that helps.
Controls seem a bit delayed but overall a great final Fantasy experience

My phone's relatively new quad core with 2gb of ram and I'm getting a bit of choppiness moving around areas with background animation (ie., the smoke in narshe). How could a 2D game like this have much more lag than it's predecessor (ffiv) which is full 3D? The lag is tolerable, I'm just surprised that there is any at all.
The essential Final Fantasy in my books. If there is one classic FF that should never be missed, this is the one.

This game consumed my childhood and remains the quintessential Final Fantasy experience.  This version is an incredibly gorgeous rendition with some minor tweaks that I never knew I needed until I saw them.  Just one complaint, the slide to bring up the control stick is difficult to work with.  Final Fantasy Dimensions had an option for a static control stick and this game needs one too.

Played the SNES version many times. Never played the updated on with new espers and other items before. I for one love the new graphics and the slight changes in the names of some items and some of the conversations. I'm running kitkat on my moto x with no issues(also none of those other programs that were mentioned either). If you love FF this is a must buy!
It feels like I've waited ages for this release since the announcement. I loved the Android release of FFV (just finished my third play through). I'm sure I'll enjoy this at least as much.
I have been waiting for this app.  It plays just fine on my note 8
Love the game but would like square to add cloud saves in please

My all time favorite FF game comes to my phone finally, however the game will not launch on Android 4.3 at all.  Won't even load the splash screen, just crashes.  Considering this is a port of a game that came out 20 years ago with some updated graphics, I think that's pretty ridiculous.  I could have easily picked up a ROM for free that worked perfectly instead of throwing away $15 and 500mb of storage space.  I am NOT running Xposed, for the record.
Works great

Five minutes in, and already a typo. What's an "Espier', Square? These new visuals are absolutely hideous, too, looks like an RPG Maker game.  Why not use the same style as FF4 on PSP, those sprites were beautiful. Oddly, in the options, in the music test, you can see the titles of every song from the very start, so even new players will know who the final boss is, when they read the song titles.   On the positive side, the changed combat windows, rising from the bottom when a turn is ready, is a rather good idea, and works for a touch screen... though it's still not as good as actual buttons. Ultimately, I would recommend the other versions, the GBA version specifically, over this version. They're FAR cheaper, too, $16 is WAY too much for a typo-ridden script, and hideous new graphics.
I played this game on the Snes, Psx, and Gba and never finished it. BUT I WILL this time. Thank You Square Enix!!
Been playing for about 3 hrs. So far so good. I'm enjoying this little gem from my early teens.
Best final fantasy game ever

I've only played two minutes and I've noticed the following issues. It is not optimised for wide screens black bars appear in the sides and the phone doesn't stay awake during the cut scenes. Fix and I'll give 5 stars

I've been waiting for ages for this game to finally be released on Android and I'm not disappointed.  I'm running 4.4.2 on a Nexus 5 and it plays like a charm. Couldn't be happier.    The last time I played this game was in the 90s on my SNES.  This version has slightly different graphics and controls but you get used to them pretty quickly.  Otherwise this game is pure perfection.  This is the greatest RPG of all time and in my opinion one of the top 10 video games of all time.
Finally a remake to the best ff ever!!!!!
I want a refund because of his mess, ugly and barely useable menus/interface and ugly filtered sprites makes this the worst version of the great game that is Final Fantasy VI
Its pretty short sighted of Squenix that it won't run with ART. That's the future of the Android OS, which is going to make this new app a relic.
Its all good so far except Esper is misspelled as Espier in the intro.  Im not fond of the new sprites yet.  Square, please redo Xenogears soon (just flesh out disk 2 and tell the story properly)
Minus some crappy art choices and tge revamped battle system....pretty good.
Looks, sounds, runs fantastic on my HTC ONE. No complaints here. Very pleased. Ok! Back to the game!
Disable framework   Luv the game
Screen shuts off while watching the intro because the game doesn't keep the phone awake. Please fix!

Game loads but crashes during or right after the second fight. I'm using a first gen. Kindle Fire running Chameleon OS. My other Final fantasy games run perfectly fine. Square-Enix really needs to look into all of these issues and patch this game. Guess I will go back to playing IV and V for now....
Seen an early typo already. Espier. Hope not too many more in there. Please spell check soon. Otherwise it's great. Glad to have this on my phone at last.

This game marks what was the golden years of RPG games. It has a deep developing story and characters, awesome battle system, wonderful art direction...and of course one of the best video game soundtracks produced! Highly recommended and will not disappoint. Nexus 7 stock 4.2.2 working great.
THE best of the old school rpg's. Finally on mobile.  And on Android first :-) Works on my s4 and n7 2013 rooted. I love this game!

This is my second favorite FF but it's really crappy that I have to uninstall the framework every time I want to play this game. Square should be ashamed, such a despicable thing to include in a game when there's no reason for them to care in the first place. UPDATE: Why does this not have cloud saves?! It even has a G+ sign-in!  This would be such a great feature if I could play across devices and not worry if I want to wipe my phone. Such a missed opportunity...

I've been waiting for this for a very long time.  Game runs great and the upgraded visuals are fantastic.  I would have liked the music to be enhanced like many of the other final fantasy upgrades, but the original music is still amazing.   Running 4.3 and I haven't had any issues, however others are reporting that it doesn't run on 4.4 kitkat so I won't upgrade to 4.4 until I finish the game.  Final note, and this goes for all final fantasy games.  Please let us back-up our saves in some fashion (cloud, export, whatever...).
Doesn't work with xposed installed.
This is the FF game I've been waiting for.
I have wanted this game ported for so long. Finally... but I was expecting a 3d like the rest... but I'm OK with these sprites for a chance to play one of my favorites again
As someone who hasn't played FFVI in earlier years, this is a good opportunity to play one of the better known games in the Final Fantasy series. Works smoothly on Galaxy Note 3(4.3)
I know its a small issue for many but it irritates me immensely. Also a spelling error in the first scene. Please sort!

Very Dissapointing. There is very bad lag. Takes ages for sprites to appear in battle. Touch responses to commands take ages to register. There is a border and is not optimised for the screen on any device. Not on my Samsung Galaxy s4 and tab 3. Such a shame as they both have 1.5GB ram free and both still very slow. There are spelling errors all over as well.  I feel android got the beta version. Im going to wait to see what the ios offers.
Amazing game. Works on Nexus 5 Dalvik.
Does not work with Xposed enabled, you have been warned.
OMG!!

I am very disappointed. I was so excited for this port because Final Fantasy VI is my favorite RPG of all time. But It will not work on my phone with Xposed installed. Like it will not even load. Period. I am refunding until they can fix  this issue. There should be no reason for Square Enix to block phones using Xposed. I am highly disappointed and lost a lot of faith in Square because of this.
Works on Kit Kat just fine, just not if you are using ART.

What can I say. It's Final Fantasy 6 on Android. (Final Fantasy 3 on the SNES)  The music and story is intact and the game appears to be running smoothly. Get excited; Android gets this game before iOS.
Surprised it's on android first and very very glad.

Won't work with Xposed. A pointless block that renders the game useless.	There's nothing more to say. The game flat out will not boot with Xposed installed and active. Either done by incompetent programming or idiotic anti-piracy actions.  Regardless of it's intent, it makes the app useless. I should NOT have to disable a system tool in order to use a game.   Fix this. It's atrocious.
Thr best rpg ever better than ff7 yes I said it
